comments:
This happended to me in 3.2RC2.

I found these in the log file. Seems strange to me that it tries to load javadoc for class "e" (the is another entry later about "GetBooleanAction").

I never asked for a Javadoc (Shift+F2) of any class, all these happened during code completion. My firewall also alerts me that Eclipse tries to connect to java.sun.com.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 133348 ***
RC3 should offer a better support for UI hanging.

No obfuscated there. It is a plugin project.
I use a personal firewall which blocks java network access, hence the errors.
Then you should use a local javadoc and update the javadoc attachment accordingly.
But I has never asked for a Javadoc. Why would Eclipse want to download it?
